Package io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.spi

Interface HalResourceLoader

Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface @ConsumerType public interface HalResourceLoader
An interface to delegate (or mock) the actual loading (and caching) of all JSON+HAL resources loaded via HalApiClient and Rhyme to any other HTTP client client implementation. The implementation needs to be thread safe, and the same instance can be re-used throughout your application life-cycle.

If you don't need any configuration options (e.g. authentication), caching or asynchronous request handling, you can can simply use create() to create an instance that is using HttpURLConnection to execute the HTTP requests while blocking the current request.

If you need full control over the HTTP client implementation to be used, and/or want to enable caching of HAL responses, you should use a HalResourceLoaderBuilder to configure and build a HalResourceLoader instance. For caching to work properly, it is important that you'll then store and re-use the same HalResourceLoader instance when creating Rhyme or HalApiClient objects

You can also implement this interface yourself, but this will require you to also implement the JSON parsing and exception handling according to the expectations of the HalApiClient implementation. A simpler way is to implement the callback-style HttpClientSupport interface, and then use HalResourceLoaderBuilder.withCustomHttpClient(HttpClientSupport) to adapt it. In both cases, you should extend the io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.testing.client.AbstractHalResourceLoaderTest (from the testing module) to test your implementation against a Wiremock server, to ensure that all expectations regarding response and error handling are met.

See Also:
  • HttpClientSupport
  • HalResourceLoaderBuilder
  • RhymeBuilder.withResourceLoader(HalResourceLoader)
  • HalApiClient.create(HalResourceLoader)

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static HalResourceLoader
    create()
    Create a HalResourceLoader that uses a HttpURLConnection with default configuration to load the upstream resources.

    Provides the response to a GET request for the given URL.

  • Method Details

    • getHalResource

      io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Single<HalResponse> getHalResource(String uri)
      Provides the response to a GET request for the given URL. The returned Single will only emit a HalResponse if the request was successful (i.e. a 200 status with a valid JSON body was returned). If anything goes wrong during the request cycle, the Single fails with HalApiClientException which gives you access to the status code and root cause of the failure.
      Parameters:
      uri - the URI of the resource to load. This is usually a fully qualified HTTP(S) URL, but it could be any URI (depending on how the entry point was loaded and which kind of links are represented in the upstream resources)
      Returns:
      a Single that emits a HalResponse entity if the request was successful, or otherwise fails with a HalApiClientException

    • create

      static HalResourceLoader create()
      Create a HalResourceLoader that uses a HttpURLConnection with default configuration to load the upstream resources.
      Returns:
      a HalResourceLoader that can handle fully qualified HTTP or HTTPS URIs, blocks the current thread while loading the resource, and does not implement any caching

    • create

      static HalResourceLoader create(HttpClientSupport client)
      Create a HalResourceLoader that uses a custom HTTP client, but does not implement any caching. You can also use HalResourceLoaderBuilder instead (if you need or caching or additional customization).
      Parameters:
      client - the HTTP client implementation to load the upstream resources
      Returns:
      a HalResourceLoader that is using that client but doesn't add any caching
      See Also:
      • HalResourceLoaderBuilder
